titles.title: Protecting Collective Bargaining Agreements Under One-Touch Make-Ready Act
Protecting Collective Bargaining Agreements Under One-Touch Make-Ready Act

A bill to clarify that the "one-touch make-ready" rules of the Federal Communication Commission for utility pole attachments do not supersede the National Labor Relations Act or collective bargaining agreements.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary:
Protecting Collective Bargaining Agreements Under One-Touch Make-Ready Act
This bill makes inapplicable any provision of the Federal Communications Commission rules relating to telecommunications attachments to utility poles that conflicts with certain labor laws or an existing collective bargaining agreement.
